metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3971 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Summer Institute of Linguistics (SIL) Graphite 2, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 15.0, Thunderbird before 15.0, and SeaMonkey before 2.12, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via vectors related to the (1) Silf::readClassMap and (2) Pass::readPass functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3971` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libgraphite2-3 - 1.2.1-1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
graphite2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
